00086     // Framework-Application Integration Type
00087     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
00088     //  Option Label                    :: Option Behavior
00089     //.................................................................................................
00090     //  MTOUCH_CONTROLS_ISR             :: The framework defines and controls 100% of the ISR.
00091     //  MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_ISR          :: The application's ISR function is responsible for calling mTouch_Scan().
00092     //  MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_MAINLOOP     :: The mainloop mTouch API will automatically call the scan function.    
00093     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
00094     
00095     #define MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE         MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_ISR
00096 
00097     
00098         // If MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE is defined as either MTOUCH_CONTROLS_ISR or MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_ISR,
00099         // this option will determine which timer is used to clock the mTouch scan routine.
00100         #define MTOUCH_ISR_TIMER            0       // NOTE: You are responsible for initializing
00101                                                     //       the timer with any desired pre- or
00102                                                     //       post-scaling options including any
00103                                                     //       period registers (PR2/4/6). 
00104                                                     // 8-bit Timers Only. Not compatible with TMR1/3/5.
00105

00107     // mTouch Scan Method Functionality
00108     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
00109     //  Option Label                    :: Option Behavior
00110     //.................................................................................................
00111     //  MTOUCH_SCANS_ONE_SENSOR         :: One mTouch function call will result in one sensor being scanned once.
00112     //  MTOUCH_SCANS_ALL_SENSORS        :: One mTouch function call will result in all sensors being scanned once.
00113     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
00114 
00115     #define MTOUCH_SCAN_FUNCTIONALITY       MTOUCH_SCANS_ONE_SENSOR

00121     //  Option Label                    :: Option Behavior
00122     //.................................................................................................
00123     //  MTOUCH_ALWAYS_CONTROLS_ADC      :: ADC is considered under the control of the framework at all times.
00124     //  MTOUCH_RELEASES_ADC_AFTER_SCAN  :: ADC is released and available for use between scans.
00125     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

00131                                                     // System Version Control
00132                                                     //
00133                                                     //  These values are used only when communicating
00134                                                     //  with the mTouch PC software to relay
00135                                                     //  information about the current version of
00136                                                     //  firmware being used.
00137                                                     //
00138     #define MTOUCH_BOARD_ID                 0x00    //  Which board is this? 
00139                                                     //      Used in 'V2' mTouch GUI to identify the board.
00140                                                     //      No effect on framework behavior.
00141     #define MTOUCH_HARDWARE_VERSION         0x01    //  Which hardware revision?
00142                                                     //      Displayed in 'V2' mTouch GUI. 
00143                                                     //      No effect on framework behavior.
00144     #define MTOUCH_FRAMEWORK_VERSION        0x20    //  Which version of the mTouch framework is this?
00145                                                     //      Displayed in 'V2' mTouch GUI. 
00146                                                     //      No effect on framework behavior.
00147     #define MTOUCH_SOFTWARE_VERSION         0x01    //  Which version of user-application code is this?
00148                                                     //      Displayed in 'V2' mTouch GUI. 
00149                                                     //      No effect on framework behavior.

00152     // mTouch EEPROM Configuration Value Storage
00153     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
00154     //#define MTOUCH_EEPROM_ENABLED                 // <-- If defined, mTouch configuration values
00155                                                     //     will be stored in and read from EEPROM.
00156                                                     //     This allows for real-time updates to values
00157                                                     //     such as debounce max values, and thresholds.
00158                                                     //     The mComm module can be used to read/write
00159                                                     //     these values. See mComm_config.h.
00160                                                     
00161         #define MTOUCH_EEPROM_START_ADR     0x02    // <-- If EEPROM is enabled, this value determines
00162                                                     //     where the starting address of the mTouch
00163                                                     //     storage block will be located.
00164                                                     //      Valid Values: Must be 0x02 or higher.
00165                                                     //  
00166                                                     //     DO NOT CHOOSE 0x00:
00167                                                     //      Brown-out resets may result in unwanted 
00168                                                     //      EEPROM writes to address 0x00 - so this 
00169                                                     //      address should always be skipped.
00170                                                     //
00171                                                     //     DO NOT CHOOSE 0x01:
00172                                                     //      An initialization byte is placed at location
00173                                                     //      0x01 to determine if the EEPROM has been
00174                                                     //      initialized. By checking this byte, we can
00175                                                     //      initialize the configuration values on the
00176                                                     //      first power up, and leave them alone for all
00177                                                     //      future power ups.
00178                                                     //
00179                                                     //     NOTE: MTOUCH_EEPROM_END_ADR will be defined
00180                                                     //           automatically to let you know the
00181                                                     //           address of the final mTouch value.
00182                                                     
00183         #define MTOUCH_EEPROM_INIT_VALUE    0xBD    // <-- If EEPROM is enabled, the first time the 
00184                                                     //     EEPROM is initialized, it will load this
00185                                                     //     value into the starting address location.
00186                                                     //     On power-up after that, the device will
00187                                                     //     see that this value is already loaded into
00188                                                     //     EEPROM and will not re-initialize. This
00189                                                     //     allows the device to maintain its
00190                                                     //     configuration through power cycles.
00191                                                     //
00192                                                     //     NOTE: When programming the device, the
00193                                                     //           first 8 bytes of EEPROM will be
00194                                                     //           cleared (0xFF) to reset the mTouch
00195                                                     //           EEPROM initialization byte and force
00196                                                     //           a rewrite of the EEPROM values.
00197                                                     //      On normal device power up, the init value
00198                                                     //           is not erased.
00199                                                     
00200         #define MTOUCH_EEPROM_STORED_IN_RAM         // <-- If EEPROM is enabled and this value is
00201                                                     //     defined, the mTouch configuration options
00202                                                     //     will be stored in a RAM array - not in EEPROM.
00203                                                     //     This can be used to support two-way
00204                                                     //     communications on PICs with no EEPROM or
00205                                                     //     as a way to reset to factory settings when
00206                                                     //     the processor is powered off.
00207         
00208

00214 // |____/ \___|_| |_|___/\___/|_|    |____/ \___|\__|\__,_| .__/ 
00215 //                                                        |_|

00220                                                     //     be scanned. This includes all matrix,
00221                                                     //     proximity, button, or slider traces.

00260     // Press Threshold Configuration
00261     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR0     500         
00262     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR1     500         /// @cond
00263     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR2     500         // <-- Required difference between the sensor's baseline
00264     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR3     500         //     value and the current reading to trigger a press    
00265     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR4     500         //     Allowable Range :: [ 1 to 65535 ]
00266     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR5     500        
00267     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR6     500  
00268     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR7     500  
00269     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR8     500  
00270     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR9     500  
00271     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR10    500
00272     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR11    500
00273     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR12    500
00274     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR13    500
00275     
00276     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR14    200
00277     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR15    200
00278     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR16    200
00279     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR17    200
00280     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR18    200
00281     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR19    200
00282     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR20    200
00283     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR21    200      
00284     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR22    200         // TIP:
00285     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR23    200         // Extra threshold definitions for sensors that are not
00286     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR24    200         // implemented can be ignored.
00287     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR25    200  
00288     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR26    200  
00289     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR27    200  
00290     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR28    200  
00291     #define THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR29    200

00296     #define MTOUCH_RELEASE_THRESH_FACTOR    0.5     // <-- Defines the hysteresis between press and release
00297                                                     //     In other words, '0.4' would result in a release
00298                                                     //     threshold equal to 40% of the press threshold.
00299                                                     //     
00300                                                     //     Example: With a finger on the sensor, the reading
00301                                                     //      settles to a value (1000). When a finger is added, 
00302                                                     //      we see the reading increase (1200). The press 
00303                                                     //      threshold is then set to determine how much shift
00304                                                     //      we want to see before we get a press. In this case
00305                                                     //      we see a shift of 200. So we can set the threshold
00306                                                     //      to 160. The release threshold is a percentage of
00307                                                     //      the press threshold. If set to 0.4, it will be
00308                                                     //      40% of the 160 press threshold, or '64' counts.
00309                                                     //      So the sensor will remain pressed until the reading
00310                                                     //      returns to a value of 1064 or less.
00311                                                     //
00312                                                     //     Allowable Range :: [ 0.30 to 1.00 ]
00313  
00314 
00315 
00316 //****************************************************************************************************
00317 //  _____ _ _ _            _             
00318 // |  ___(_) | |_ ___ _ __(_)_ __   __ _ 
00319 // | |_  | | | __/ _ \ '__| | '_ \ / _` |
00320 // |  _| | | | ||  __/ |  | | | | | (_| |
00321 // |_|   |_|_|\__\___|_|  |_|_| |_|\__, |
00322 //                                 |___/ 
00323 //
00324 //****************************************************************************************************
00325 
00326     #define MTOUCH_SAMPLES_PER_SCAN     30          // <-- Number of times each sensor will be scanned 
00327                                                     //     before asserting the mTouch_state.dataReady 
00328                                                     //     bit. See the mTouch Framework's documentation 
00329                                                     //     for help achieving a specific response time.
00330                                                     //     Allowed Range :: [ 1 to 65535 ]
00331                                                 
00332     #define MTOUCH_BASELINE_WEIGHT      3           // <-- Determines the weight given to the reading
00333     // The configuration option formerly known as   //     in the calculation of a new baseline average.
00334     //  MTOUCH_AVG_UPDATE                           //     The reading will have a weight of 
00335                                                     //     1/(2^MTOUCH_BASELINE_WEIGHT) in the baseline 
00336                                                     //     calculation. 
00337                                                     //     Example: If this value is '3', the baseline 
00338                                                     //              calculation would be:
00339                                                     //        baseline = (1/8)*reading + (7/8)*baseline
00340                                                     //     Example: If this value is '2', the baseline 
00341                                                     //              calculation would be:
00342                                                     //        baseline = (1/4)*reading + (3/4)*baseline
00343                                                     //     Allowed Values :: [ 1 to 4 ]
00344 
00345     #define MTOUCH_BASELINE_RATE        10          // <-- Determines how often the baseline average will
00346     // The configuration option formerly known as   //     be updated. A new calculation will occur every
00347     //  MTOUCH_AVG_RATE                             //     N'th mTouch decode service call, where 'N' is 
00348                                                     //     this value. (Fastest = 1)
00349                                                     //     Allowed Range :: [ 1 to 65535 ]
00350 
00351     #define MTOUCH_DECIMATION_MAX_STEP  10          // <-- Maximum change allowed during one CVD sample
00352     
00353     #define MTOUCH_JITTER_BITS          6           // <-- Determines the number of bits to use to implement
00354                                                     //     a randomized delay between mTouch scans.
00355                                                     //     Allowed Range :: [ 0 to 8 ], 0 = off.
00356 
00357     #define MTOUCH_SCALING              1           // <-- Defines the degree of post-scaling that is 
00358                                                     //     implemented on the acquisition's accumulation
00359                                                     //     register before being stored as the result.
00360                                                     //     The scaling factor should be set so that it is
00361                                                     //     not possible for the result register to overflow 
00362                                                     //     (Max result output value is 65535.)
00363                                                     //     Set this equal to the number of times to 
00364                                                     //     right-shift the value.
00365                                                     //     Allowed Range :: [ 0 to 8 ]
00366                                                     //       0 - No scaling is performed.
00367                                                     //           1:1 ratio between accumulator and result
00368                                                     //
00369                                                     //       4 - Accumulator is divided by 16.
00370                                                     //           16:1 ratio between accumulator and result
00371                                                     //
00372                                                     //       8 - Accumulator is divided by 256.
00373                                                     //           256:1 ratio between accumulator and result
00374                                                     //
00375                                                 
00376                                             
00377                                                 
00378

00381 // |  _ \  ___  ___ ___   __| (_)_ __   __ _

00384 // |____/ \___|\___\___/ \__,_|_|_| |_|\__, |
00385 //                                     |___/

00389     #define MTOUCH_POWER_UP_SAMPLES     30          // <-- Determines the number of initialization samples
00390                                                     //     taken at power up. Each sensor will be decoded
00391                                                     //     this number of times.
00392                                                     //     Allowable Range :: [ 1 to 65535 ]
00393 
00394     #define     MTOUCH_BUTTON_TIMEOUT       300         // <-- Number of consecutive 'pressed' decode decisions
00395                                                     //     before the sensor's state is reset. 
00396                                                     //     See the note, below, for more information about
00397                                                     //     how the baseline's behavior changes when a timeout
00398                                                     //     condition occurs.
00399                                                     //     
00400                                                     //     Allowable Range :: [ 0 to 65535 ], '0' is off.
00401                                                 
00402     #define     MTOUCH_DEBOUNCE_RELEASE     0           // <-- Number of consecutive scans a button must be seen
00403                                                     //     as released before a 'released state' is declared
00404                                                     //     Allowable Range :: [ 0 to 65535 ], '0' is off.
00405  
00406     #define     MTOUCH_DEBOUNCE_PRESS           0           // <-- Number of consecutive scans a button must be seen 
00407                                                     //     as pressed before a 'pressed state' is declared
00408                                                     //     Allowable Range :: [ 0 to 65535 ], '0' is off.
00409                                                 
00410     //#define MTOUCH_TOGGLE_ENABLED                 // <-- If enabled, a toggle latch bit will be implemented for
00411                                                     //     each active sensor. You can access the current toggle
00412                                                     //     state using mTouch_GetToggleState(i).
00413                                                     
00414     //#define MTOUCH_ERROR_DETECTION_ENABLED        // <-- If enabled, implements the mTouch_errorDetect()
00415                                                     //     function which can be called by the application to
00416                                                     //     verify that all enabled sensor lines are floating and
00417                                                     //     are not being held high or low. If one is found to be
00418                                                     //     in this condition, the mTouch_state.error flag is set.
00419 
00420                                                     
00421     // NOTE: The MTOUCH_NEGATIVE_CAPACITANCE option has been removed. The baseline now automatically changes its
00422     //       behavior after a timeout has occured to solve the issue this option was addressing. On-press, the
00423     //       baseline remains at the unpressed value of the sensor. After a button timeout has occurred, the 
00424     //       baseline is reset to the current value of the sensor (the pressed value). This triggers a special
00425     //       flag (mTouch_stateVars.active.sensor[i].timeout) which causes the baseline to look for the next
00426     //       large (> 1/2 * Press Threshold) negative shift. When this shift occurs, the baseline will quickly
00427     //       update itself until the difference between the reading and the baseline is less than the release
00428     //       threshold. This allows the average to maintain steady filtering while still providing fast recovery
00429     //       in case of a timeout condition.
00430                                                     
00431                                                     
00432     // mTouch Matrix and Most-Pressed Algorithm Options
00433     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
00434     
00435     #define MTOUCH_MOST_PRESSED_THRESHOLD   10      // <-- MUST BE DEFINED FOR BOTH MATRIX AND MOST-PRESSED-ONLY
00436                                                     //     This option determines how much more pressed the
00437                                                     //     most-pressed sensor must be above all other sensors
00438                                                     //     in order to allow activation. 
00439                                                     //     This must also be defined if there is a matrix being
00440                                                     //     implemented. The matrix will automatically run a most-
00441                                                     //     pressed algorithm on the rows and columns separately.
00442                                                     //     It needs this value to determine if the row/column is
00443                                                     //     sufficiently more-pressed than another.
00444     
00445     //#define MTOUCH_MATRIX_ENABLED                 // <-- If enabled, the framework will implement a matrix.
00446                                                     //     The sensors implementing the rows must all be grouped
00447                                                     //     together by index. The same is true for the columns.
00448                                                     //     To have both matrix and non-matrix sensors, the matrix
00449                                                     //     sensors must be grouped together and either at the start
00450                                                     //     or end of all the sensors.
00451                                                     //
00452         #define MTOUCH_MATRIX_ROW_START         0   // <-- The sensor index of the first row
00453         #define MTOUCH_MATRIX_ROW_END           1   // <-- The sensor index of the last row
00454                                                     //
00455         #define MTOUCH_MATRIX_COLUMN_START      2   // <-- The sensor index of the first column
00456         #define MTOUCH_MATRIX_COLUMN_END        3   // <-- The sensor index of the last column
00457                                                     //
00458                                                     //      
00459                                                     //     Examples:    VALID       VALID       INVALID     INVALID   
00460                                                     //
00461                                                     //     Sensor0    / ROW0        Normal      Normal    / ROW0
00462                                                     //     Sensor1    | ROW1        Normal    / ROW0      \ ROW1
00463                                                     //     Sensor2    | COL0      / COL0      | ROW1        Normal
00464                                                     //     Sensor3    | COL1      | COL1      | COL0        Normal
00465                                                     //     Sensor4    \ COL2      | COL2      | COL1      / COL0
00466                                                     //     Sensor5      Normal    | ROW0      \ COL2      | COL1
00467                                                     //     Sensor6      Normal    \ ROW1        Normal    \ COL2
00468                                                     //     --------------------------------------------------------
00469                                                     //     ROW_START      0           5         Matrix      Matrix
00470                                                     //     ROW_END        1           6         sensors     sensors
00471                                                     //     COL_START      2           2         not at      not
00472                                                     //     COL_END        4           4         beginning   grouped
00473                                                     //                                          or end
00474     
00475     
00476     //#define MTOUCH_MOST_PRESSED_ONLY                // <-- If enabled, only one non-matrix, active sensor will be 
00477                                                     //     able to be in the pressed state at any given time. 
00478                                                     //     In order for a sensor to enter the pressed state with
00479                                                     //     this option enabled, it must:
00480                                                     //      1. Be pressed enough to cross the sensor's press
00481                                                     //         threshold value. (ex: THRESHOLD_PRESS_SENSOR0)
00482                                                     //      2. Be more pressed than the second-most-pressed sensor
00483                                                     //         by at least MTOUCH_MOST_PRESSED_THRESHOLD.
00484                                                     //
00485                                                     //     NOTE: Matrix sensors are separated from 'normal' sensors
00486                                                     //           and are not compared with each other. Matrix
00487                                                     //           sensors are automatically split into their 'row'
00488                                                     //           and 'column' groups to find the most pressed.
00489                                                     
00490     
00491 
00492 //****************************************************************************************************
00493 //  ____                _           _ _         
00494 // |  _ \ _ __ _____  _(_)_ __ ___ (_) |_ _   _ 
00495 // | |_) | '__/ _ \ \/ / | '_ ` _ \| | __| | | |
00496 // |  __/| | | (_) >  <| | | | | | | | |_| |_| |
00497 // |_|   |_|  \___/_/\_\_|_| |_| |_|_|\__|\__, |
00498 //                                        |___/ 
00499 //****************************************************************************************************
00500     
00501     //
00502     // NOTE: To enable a proximity sensor, you must perform two steps:
00503     //      
00504     //      1. Define MTOUCH_NUMBER_PROXIMITY with the number of proximity sensors in total.
00505     //         This is used to determine how large to make the arrays.
00506     //
00507     //      2. There must be one MTOUCH_SENSOR#_IS_PROX definition per enabled proximity sensor.
00508     //         The value of the definition must be it's "proximity-id" value.
00509     //         "Proximity-ID" is used as an index to the proximity variables. In total, the IDs
00510     //         should start at 0 and end with MTOUCH_NUMBER_PROXIMITY-1. The order is arbitrary.
00511     //
00512     //          Example:
00513     //
00514     //              #define MTOUCH_NUMBER_PROXIMITY     2
00515     //
00516     //              #define MTOUCH_SENSOR5_IS_PROX      0
00517     //              #define MTOUCH_SENSOR2_IS_PROX      1
00518     //
00519     
00520     
00521     #define MTOUCH_NUMBER_PROXIMITY     0               // Defines how many proximity sensors are activated
00522 
00523     #define MTOUCH_SENSOR3_IS_PROX      0               // MTOUCH_SENSOR3 is a proximity sensor with index 0
00524     #define MTOUCH_SENSOR1_IS_PROX      1               // MTOUCH_SENSOR1 is a proximity sensor with index 1
00525     
00526     // mTouch Proximity Filtering Options
00527     //:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
00528         #define MTOUCH_PROX_BUFFER_SIZE         5   // <-- This determines the size of the buffer used
00529                                                     //     in the proximity filter.
00530                                                     //     
00531                                                     //     Options -
00532                                                     //      5   :: Least filtering, fastest response time
00533                                                     //      9   ::
00534                                                     //      15  :: Most filtering, longest response time
00535                                                     
00536         #define MTOUCH_PROX_REMOVE_EXTREME      1   // <-- The N largest and N smallest values in the
00537                                                     //     buffer will be removed. The remaining values
00538                                                     //     will then be averaged to achieve a mean result.
00539                                                     //
00540                                                     //     This value is 'N'. It must be less than half
00541                                                     //     the buffer size.
00542 
00543     
00544         #define MTOUCH_PROX_USE_32BIT_ACCUM         // <-- If defined, the accumulator used during the
00545                                                     //     decoding process of the proximity sensor will
00546                                                     //     be implemented as a 32-bit value. This solves
00547                                                     //     overflow problems - at the cost of additional
00548                                                     //     temporary RAM requirements.
00549     
00550 
00551 //****************************************************************************************************
00552 //  ____  _ _     _                                 _  __        ___               _     
00553 // / ___|| (_) __| | ___ _ __ ___    __ _ _ __   __| | \ \      / / |__   ___  ___| |___ 
00554 // \___ \| | |/ _` |/ _ \ '__/ __|  / _` | '_ \ / _` |  \ \ /\ / /| '_ \ / _ \/ _ \ / __|
00555 //  ___) | | | (_| |  __/ |  \__ \ | (_| | | | | (_| |   \ V  V / | | | |  __/  __/ \__ \
00556 // |____/|_|_|\__,_|\___|_|  |___/  \__,_|_| |_|\__,_|    \_/\_/  |_| |_|\___|\___|_|___/
00557 //

00574 // #define APFCON_INITIALIZED       // For processors with an APFCON register(s), this 
00575 //                                  // #define can be uncommented to stop the mTouch 
00576 //                                  // Framework from producing a "remember to set 
00577 //                                  // APFCON" warning.
00578 //                                  //
00579 //                                  // RULE OF PROGRAMMING #4: Register bits initialize, 
00580 //                                  //      by law, to the value you don't want. Always 
00581 //                                  //      explicitly initialize.
